awd_titl_txt: REU: Development of Membrane Inlet Mass Spectrometry (MIMS) for Photosynthesis and Other Studies of Dissolved Gas Fluxes
awd_abstract_narration: This award supports a two year effort to develop a membrane                inlet system for mass spectrometry and to use it in preliminary                 measurements of oxygen flux during phytoplankton photosynthesis.                The initial photosynthetic studies are a novel approach to                      phytoplankton photosynthesis and respiration and in addition, the               membrane inlet system can be used for a variety of marine                       studies of biologically active gases.  These latter applications                include carbon dioxide so that a small portion of the award will                be made as part of the Global Ocean Flux Study (GOFS).

inst.inst_name: University of Maryland Center for Environmental Sciences
